thread.title: Homeowners faced with big bills to fix dams deemed unsafe
thread.title_full: Homeowners faced with big bills to fix dams deemed unsafe - US News

author: USNews
title: Homeowners faced with big bills to fix dams deemed unsafe
text:
Homeowners across South Carolina face big bills to fix dams following historic flood Associated Press Oct. 26, 2015 | 2:56 p.m. EDT + More By SEANNA ADCOX, Associated Press
COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) â€” People who live around dozens of lakes in South Carolina are under emergency orders to repair or replace dams that ruptured or were deemed unsafe by inspectors after historic rains this month.
Those people face staggering bills ranging from thousands of dollars to perhaps millions and they don't have a lot to time to develop their plans or any certainty about how to pay for the projects.
Privately owned dams generally aren't eligible for help from the Federal Emergency Management Agency, and they're unlikely to be covered by private insurance. How much all of it will cost is still unknown.
The dam owners face an Oct. 30 deadline from the state's environmental agency to hire an engineer and figure it out.
